Commands

Enum BasicCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<BasicCommand>
      • Commands.BasicCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<BasicCommand>

    public enum BasicCommand
extends java.lang.Enum<BasicCommand>
implements Command
    An enumeration of all the possible basic commands. As for now, these are: moving, turning (both clock- and counterclockwise), shooting, and picking up and using an item.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Brecht Gosselé & William Mauclet 2BiR: wtk-cws (Gosselé) en cws-elt(Mauclet)

      • getNbBasicCommands

        public int getNbBasicCommands()
        Returns the number of BasicCommands this command consists of.
        Specified by:
        getNbBasicCommands in interface Command
        Returns:
        The number of BasicCommands this command consists of, namely 1.

      • containsNextStep

        public boolean containsNextStep(Robot robot,
                       int lastStep)
        Returns whether this command contains a BasicCommand the given robot has not yet executed, and can execute.
        Specified by:
        containsNextStep in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot for which to check if it can execute a basic command in this command.
        lastStep - An integer defining unambiguously the last basic command the robot has executed of this command.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating whether this BasicCommand contains a BasicCommand the given robot has not yet executed. This will always be true if the robot has not yet executed this basic command, thus if and only if the parameter lastStep equals 0.

      • getStepNbOfNextStep

        public int getStepNbOfNextStep(Robot robot,
                      int lastStep)
        Returns the step number of the next BasicCommand the robot can execute in this command.
        Specified by:
        getStepNbOfNextStep in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot for which to look up the next basic command it can execute in this command.
        lastStep - An integer defining unambiguously the last basic command the robot has executed of this command.
        Returns:
        An integer indicating the stepNb of the next executable BasicCommand in this command for the given robot. This will always be the first step of this basic command, thus the returned integer always equals 1.

      • executeStep

        public void executeStep(Robot robot,
               int stepNb)
        Executes the given step of this command
        Specified by:
        executeStep in interface Command
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot that should execute a step of this command.
